trial_identification.studytitle: Phase I Study of MIK665, a Mcl-1 Inhibitor, in Patients With Refractory or Relapsed Lymphoma or Multiple Myeloma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Phase I Open Label, Multi-center Study to Characterize the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Intravenously Administered MIK665, a Mcl-1 Inhibitor, in Patients With Refractory or Relapsed Lymphoma or Multiple Myeloma

conditions.healthcondition: Multiple Myeloma (MM), Lymphoma, Large B-Cell, Diffuse (DLBCL), Lymphoma

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Lymphoma (non Hodgkin's lymphoma) - High grade lymphoma
Lymphoma (non Hodgkin's lymphoma) - Low grade lymphoma

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - MIK665
Experimental: MIK665 -
Treatment: drugs: MIK665 MIK665

primaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence and severity of AEs and SAEs, incl. changes in laboratory parameters, vital signs and ECGs.
Incidence of DLTs during the first cycle of treatment with single agent MIK665 during the dose escalation phase only

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Best Overall response (BOR) per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria for Myeloma; and per revised criteria for staging of the International Working Group (IWG) guidelines for Lymphoma
Area Under Curve (AUC) - Plasma PK parameter
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) - Plasma PK parameter
Terminal elimination half-life (T1/2) - Plasma PK parameter
Apparent volume of distribution (Vz) - Plasma PK parameter
Duration of Response (DOR)per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria for Myeloma; and per revised criteria for staging of the International Working Group (IWG) guidelines for Lymphoma

Progression Free Survival (PFS) per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria for Myeloma; and per revised criteria for staging of the International Working Group (IWG) guidelines for Lymphoma

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Inclusion Criteria
- Age = 18 years.
- Histologically confirmed lymphoma (WHO classification), or confirmed MM (IMWG), that is relapsed and/or refractory.
- Other Inclusion Criteria May Apply.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Exclusion Criteria
- Known history of chronic liver disease
- History of chronic pancreatitis.
- Prior treatment with Mcl-1 inhibitor.
- Other Exclusion Criteria May Apply.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this first in human study is to assess safety, tolerability, PK and preliminary clinical activity and to estimate the MTD(s)/RDE(s) of MIK665 (also referred as S64315) as single agent administered intravenously (i.v.) in adult patients with refractory or relapsed lymphoma or multiple myeloma.
